snippet: Adlène Hicheur, a French-Algerian particle physicist, was arrested in October 2009 over his correspondence with an affiliate of Al Qaeda.
abstract: Paris court sentences Adlene Hicheur, French-Algerian particle physicist, to five years in prison, ruling that his e-mail exchanges in 2009 with a presumed member of Al Qaeda is a criminal act; trial raises difficult questions about the possible excesses of French antiterrorism law, which in effect treats intent as a criminal act.

byline.contributor: Maïa de la Baume contributed reporting from Paris, and Dennis Overbye from New York.

lead_paragraph: Adlène Hicheur, a French-Algerian particle physicist, was arrested in October 2009 over his correspondence with an affiliate of Al Qaeda.

headline.seo: CERN Scientist Sentenced to 5 Years in Terrorism Case
headline.main: Scientist Sentenced in French Terror Case
headline.print_headline: Scientist Sentenced in French Terror Case

keywords.value: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
